headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 14 at 12:33PM PDT until September 15 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
instruction:
Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or
stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly
in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
description:
* WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves are expected
due to elevated surf of 3 to 6 feet. Occasionally larger and
suddenly more powerful sets are possible.

* WHERE...Coastal areas of Ventura and Los Angeles Counties.

* WHEN...Through Wednesday evening.

* IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning. Rip currents
can pull swimmers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches
and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. Very isolated and
minor flooding of beaches around Zuma is possible during the
evening high tides.

headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 12 at 2:12PM PDT until September 15 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
instruction:
Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or
stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly
in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
description:
* WHAT...A moderately large and long period south swell will
result in elevated surf of 4 to 6 feet with local sets to 7
feet. Occasionally larger and suddenly more powerful sets are
possible along with sneaker waves. Surf will be highest on
exposed south and southwest facing beaches. There is also a high
risk of dangerous rip currents.

* WHERE...Ventura County Coast, Los Angeles County Coast and
Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands.

* WHEN...From late tonight through Wednesday evening.

* IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning. Rip currents
can pull swimmers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches
and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore.
